page.title: 04Transport,social life 1925
page.content: NEWBRIDGE IN 1925 (contd) ___________________________ researched by Liane Davies Q.What was transport like? There was a railway,a canal,horse and carts,and a few Charabancs,but most people used to walk. Q.What about the social life? Families were very close_knit and very religious.Most families attended chapels or churches regularly on Sundays.It was common practice for mothers to pawn their best clothes on Monday and redeem them again on Saturday to wear them the next day for chapel or church.Parents took their children on walks in the area on picnic outings.The evening life consisted of entertainment within the home.Men would go out to drink but women were not allowed in Public houses.
